Migrate task-dashboard from tmux/Perl to Kitty session
description:
Current: Perl script managing tmux sessions (bin/task-dashboard)
Target: Kitty session file + watcher script for auto-refresh

Benefits:
- Native GPU-accelerated rendering (no tmux overhead)
- Simpler config (kitty session format)
- Better macOS integration
- Auto-refresh via file watcher

Implementation:
1. Create config/kitty/sessions/taskwarrior.kitty-session
2. Define layout: next report, today view, burndown, timew summary, tasksh
3. Write Bun watcher script to refresh on task changes
4. Hook watcher into taskwarrior on-modify hook
5. Add launcher alias (task-dashboard or similar)

Note: Kitty session only (local macOS use), auto-refresh is critical requirement

description:
Research existing OpenCode notification plugins from the ecosystem/community.

Current state:
- Local boomerang-notify.ts exists but may not be complete
- Need to check OpenCode ecosystem for battle-tested solutions

Research tasks:
1. Check OpenCode ecosystem page for notification plugins
2. Search GitHub for opencode notification plugins
3. Check OpenCode Discord for recommendations
4. Evaluate options based on:
   - macOS notification center support
   - Terminal bell/visual flash support

   - Error notifications
   - Customization options
5. Document findings and recommend best plugin to use

Potential sources:
- https://opencode.ai/docs/ecosystem#plugins
- GitHub search: 'opencode notification plugin'
- OpenCode Discord community
- npm search: 'opencode-' packages

title: Migrate timewarrior duration hook from Python to Bun/TypeScript
description:
Current: Python script (config/taskwarrior/hooks/on-modify-timewarrior-duration.py)
Target: Bun/TypeScript with bunx shebang for faster execution

Benefits:
- Faster runtime (Bun vs Python)
- Native JSON handling
- Modern TypeScript with type safety
- Simpler dependency management

Implementation:
1. Rewrite hook in TypeScript with bunx shebang
2. Port subprocess calls to Bun.spawn()
3. Add types for taskwarrior/timewarrior data structures
4. Update nix module to install new hook
5. Test with actual task start/stop workflow

beads-send: handle task descriptions with special characters
description:
Task descriptions with colons, parentheses, and other special characters break try workspace creation and subsequent operations.

Example failing description: 'Review test: add MiniTest-based tests and CI (mini.nvim)'

Issues:
1. Special chars in description create invalid directory names
2. taskopen fails with 'No actions applicable' 
3. addnote command not found (taskopen fallback)

Need to sanitize task descriptions before passing to try.

Enable goose iOS app connectivity via headless daemon
description: The goose AI iOS app requires goose Desktop (Electron GUI) with its built-in Lapstone tunnel. Currently there's no headless daemon mode that exposes the API endpoints the iOS app expects. Track upstream progress on GitHub issue #6251 (daemon endpoint refactoring) which might eventually enable this. For now, browser access works via https://nuc.cinnamon-rooster.ts.net:3002

title: Enable goose iOS app connectivity via headless daemon
OpenCode TUI crashes over SSH on NixOS NUC
description:
OpenCode TUI (libopentui.so) crashes with SIGABRT when running over SSH on headless NixOS server (NUC).

**Upstream Issue:** https://github.com/sst/opencode/issues/6119

**Symptoms:**
- Immediate crash on TUI initialization
- SIGABRT signal from bun/libopentui.so
- Works fine with `opencode serve` (headless mode)
- Affects OpenCode 1.0.224 + Bun 1.3.5

**Environment:**
- NixOS 26.05 (hardened kernel 6.12.56)
- SSH session (no local console)
- TERM and TERMINFO_DIRS set correctly

**Workarounds:**
1. Use `opencode serve` for headless API mode
2. Access NUC via VNC/console directly
3. Run OpenCode locally with sshfs mount

**Status:** Waiting for upstream fix in opentui library.

title: bugwarrior: Add post_import hook support
description:
Bugwarrior only supports pre_import hooks which run BEFORE tasks are synced to Taskwarrior. Need post_import hook to run commands AFTER import completes.

Use case: Automatically mark Linear Triage/Backlog tasks as waiting, auto-complete Done tasks.

Current workaround: Added post-import logic to bugwarrior-pull-cached wrapper script.

Upstream: Consider opening issue at https://github.com/ralphbean/bugwarrior

Add worktree helpers for jj - port DHH's agent-git-trees
description:
Port DHH's git worktree helper script (https://gist.github.com/dhh/18575558fc5ee10f15b6cd3e108ed844) to use jj instead of git.

Original functions:
- ga <branch>: Create worktree + branch, cd into it
- gd: Remove worktree + branch from within active worktree

JJ equivalent:
- ja <name>: Create jj workspace, cd into it  
- jd: Remove workspace from within active workspace

Note: jj uses 'workspace' instead of worktree, different workflow but similar concept.
